title: Cloud-Services Firm Fastly Hires Google Executive as CFO
sub_head: The San Francisco-based company went public in 2019 but has not yet turned a profit
body:
Fastly Inc. hired a Google executive to manage its finances as the cloud-services provider looks to boost its revenue.
The San Francisco-based firm, which operates a content delivery network service that many websites rely on to run faster, on Tuesday said it appointed Ronald W. Kisling as its new chief financial officer.
Mr. Kisling is set to join Fastly in August from Alphabet Inc.’s Google, where he currently serves as CFO of the company’s Fitbit unit. Google completed the $2.1 billion acquisition of the fitness-tracking company in January after European Union officials approved the transaction with concessions aimed at protecting user data and maintaining competition in the sector.
Mr. Kisling has worked at Fitbit for nearly seven years, including the past three as CFO. Before that, he was CFO at other technology companies, including semiconductor-equipment maker Nanometrics Inc. and PGP Corp., a software provider.
Fastly said Mr. Kisling is set to succeed Adriel Lares, who plans to step down after five years in the CFO-role.
